summary:
A UN-mandated fact-finding mission reported that the Rapid Support Forces' 18-month siege of El Fasher, capital of North Darfur in Sudan, bears hallmarks of genocide. The RSF has targeted Zaghawa and Fur communities for physical destruction during the ongoing Sudan war. The report details occupation tactics affecting these ethnic groups and urges international action to prevent escalation.

Pakistan conducted cross-border strikes on terrorist camps in eastern Afghanistan, killing dozens of civilians including women and children in homes and a school, according to Afghan officials. The action escalates tensions between the two countries during Ramadan. In eastern Congo, Rwanda-backed rebels overran troops and entered Goma, an aid hub sheltering over 1 million displaced people amid gunfire and shelling. The UN warned of disruptions to humanitarian operations. Separately, US President Trump raised the global tariff from 10 to 15 percent following a Supreme Court ruling, as businesses seek repayment of $133 billion already collected. The change affects importers, consumers, and global supply chains.

Israeli strikes on Hezbollah targets in Lebanon killed at least 10 people, including eight Hezbollah members, per Lebanese officials, threatening a fragile cease-fire. Israel allowed displaced Palestinians to return on foot to northern Gaza after a hostage release deadlock broke, affecting hundreds of thousands. Iranian students held large anti-government protests at universities upon reopening, the first major demonstrations since last month's crackdown that killed thousands. A US appeals court in the Fourth Circuit lifted a block on Trump administration executive orders halting federal DEI programs, affecting government workers and contractors. Crews recovered bodies of nine backcountry skiers from a Truckee Tahoe avalanche in California's Sierra Nevada four days after heavy snow. NASA and SpaceX launched Crew-10 from Kennedy Space Center to the ISS, enabling the return of astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams after nine months.

headlines.title: UN mission finds RSF siege of El Fasher bears hallmarks of genocide
headlines.summary: UN-mandated fact-finding mission details RSF's 18-month occupation of North Darfur capital, targeting Zaghawa and Fur communities for physical destruction. Affects ethnic groups amid Sudan war. Report urges international action to prevent escalation.

headlines.title: Pakistan launches cross-border strikes in Afghanistan killing dozens of civilians
headlines.summary: Pakistan targets terrorist camps in eastern Afghanistan; Afghan officials report dozens of civilians, including women and children, killed and wounded in homes and school. Escalates bilateral tensions during Ramadan. Risks broader regional conflict.

framings.angle: Details multiple strikes on terrorist training camps and hideouts amid Ramadan escalation
Emphasizes strikes hitting school and homes killing and wounding dozens of people

headlines.title: Rwanda-backed rebels overrun troops and enter Congo safe-haven city Goma
headlines.summary: Rebels advance into Goma aid hub amid gunfire and shelling; over 1 million displaced people now shelter inside. Threatens humanitarian operations in eastern Congo. UN warns of worsening crisis.

headlines.title: Trump raises US global tariff from 10 to 15 percent after Supreme Court ruling
headlines.summary: Trump increases tariff as businesses seek repayment of $133 billion already collected. Impacts importers, consumers and global supply chains. Signals continued protectionist policy amid legal challenges.

headlines.title: Israel strikes Hezbollah targets in Lebanon killing at least 10 people
headlines.summary: Strikes late Friday kill eight Hezbollah members and others, per Lebanese officials. Threatens fragile cease-fire agreement. Heightens risks of renewed cross-border conflict.

headlines.title: Iranian students stage large anti-government protests as universities reopen
headlines.summary: Students chant and march at semester start, first major protests since last month's deadly crackdown killing thousands. Builds on prior national movement. Indicates ongoing regime opposition among youth.

framings.angle: Focuses on students reviving protests into national movement as new semester begins
Highlights protests honoring thousands killed in prior nationwide crackdown

headlines.title: Israel allows displaced Palestinians to return to northern Gaza on foot
headlines.summary: Gazans cross military zone north after hostage release deadlock breaks. Affects hundreds of thousands seeking homes. Marks potential step toward de-escalation in enclave.

headlines.title: US appeals court lifts block on Trump administration DEI crackdown
headlines.summary: Fourth Circuit panel allows enforcement of executive orders halting federal DEI programs, overturning lower court. Affects government workers and contractors. Advances policy reshaping diversity initiatives.

headlines.title: Crews recover bodies of nine backcountry skiers from California avalanche
headlines.summary: Teams retrieve nine bodies four days after Truckee Tahoe avalanche amid heavy snow. Concludes search for missing group. Highlights dangers of backcountry skiing in Sierra Nevada.
headlines.previousContext: Avalanche buried skiers amid intense snowfall hindering initial rescue

headlines.title: NASA and SpaceX launch Crew-10 to retrieve astronauts stuck nine months
headlines.summary: Crew-10 launches from Kennedy Space Center to ISS for routine rotation enabling return of Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams. Affects station operations. Resolves extended mission anomaly.
headlines.previousContext: Astronauts stranded since June 2025 due to spacecraft technical issues delaying return
